name: Avoid client provided dictionaries to have high request sizes
description:
This rule will raise a violation if client provided dictionaries listed below have a large number of elements. The default limit will be 1000 and should be customizable.
HttpRequest.Files, 
HttpRequest.Form, 
HttpRequest.Cookies, 
HttpRequest.QueryString, 
HttpRequest.Headers, 
HttpRequest.ServerVariables.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale:
When web pages have a large amount of post data it can potentially lead to exhaustion of resources even with lesser number of sessions/calls. 
Attackers can hence make possible Denial of Service with less number of requests.
The default limit for the following client side dictionaries is 1000 but changing them to a higher number poses a security risk.
remediation: Never change the maxHttpCollectionKeys to more than <x>, X being the customizable limit
remediationSample:
...
  <appSettings>
    <add key="aspnet:MaxHttpCollectionKeys" value="<less than 1000>" /> //fixed
  </appSettings>
...
OR
Do not specify MaxHttpCollectionKeys at all
alternativeName: Avoid client provided dictionaries to have high request sizes
